content:
Hey @WG-learning and others --

The next rustc lecture series conference call takes place in 20 minutes (Zoom link). We will be discussing how the Ty<'tcx> type works in the compiler, including the memory allocation scheme, a bit about arenas, the TypeFoldable trait, and so forth. The video will be posted afterwards (and, hopefully, this information will be used to extend the rustc guide).

As usual, I didn't have as much time to prep as I would like, so I'm counting on some people to attend and held ask good questions. =)
Here is the Dropbox Paper document that we'll be using

Can't wait for the video!

https://twitter.com/nikomatsakis/status/1121828910646419457

Latest #rustlang video, about "representing types in rustc". This video is part of an experiment. The compiler team's learning WG will try to turn it into a rustc-guide chapter for others to read! https://youtu.be/c01TsOsr3-c

- Niko Matsakis (@nikomatsakis)
